name: Rumtek Monastery
notes: One of the most important centers of Kagyu Buddhism, known for its elaborate architecture and vibrant ceremonies.

name: Pemayangtse Monastery
access: 30 km from Pelling, accessible by road
notes: Founded in 1705, it is one of the oldest and most revered monasteries in Sikkim, known for its beautiful murals and ceremonies.

name: Enchey Monastery
notes: A 200-year-old Vajrayana Buddhist monastery amidst pine forests, famous for its annual dances and rituals.

name: Dubdi Monastery
access: 20 km from Pelling, trekking path available
notes: The oldest monastery in Sikkim, established in 1701, known for its simple architecture and historical significance.

name: Tashiding Monastery
access: Accessible by road via Singtam-Pelling route
notes: Known for its sacred Bumchu festival and panoramic views of the surrounding hills and rivers.

name: Phodong Monastery
access: Accessible by road from Gangtok, permits required
notes: Established in 1740, it houses around 260 monks and is famous for its grand assembly hall.

name: Phensang Monastery
access: Accessible from Lachung town, 30 km trek uphill
notes: Founded in 1721, rebuilt in 1948 after a fire, known for its quiet ambiance and scenic surroundings.

name: Ralang Monastery
notes: Known for its vibrant Pang Lhabsol festival and impressive collection of Buddhist relics.

name: Tendong Monastery
access: Located on Tendong Hill, reachable via short trek
notes: Situated on Tendong Hill, offering panoramic views and peaceful surroundings.

name: Sang Monastery
notes: A serene monastery known for its peaceful ambiance, meditation halls, and beautiful architecture.
